entry.title: How abaqus/standard works
entry.content:
I try to use a very simple example to demonstrate how abaqus/standard works, i.e. the performance of the core algorithm used in Abaqus/standard. Following is the example.

  1. An implicit solver and a C3D8 brick are developed in Matlab. A single element 2x2x2 cm^3 is tested.

  2. Linear elastic material model is used in the element. By taking large displacement into consideration, more accurately speaking, the material model is called hypoelasticity.

  3. The updated Lagrange format is used in the algorithm.

  4. Comparison:

From the comparison, one might find the result is different from the one given by K.J. Bathe's book. The discreprency stems from the difference of procedures to approximate/calculate stress.
entry.summary: I try to use a very simple example to demonstrate how abaqus/standard works, i.e. the performance of the core algorithm used in Abaqus/st
